content: For short stream names, like #git, I sometimes type the whole thing out without using the autocomplete, and then am surprised when it isn't linkified in the output. Should we automatically turn #git into #**git** when someone types the space after the t?
It's tricky, because people might want to type #hash_tag_donuts_in_the_conference_room.

The # symbol has three possible meanings:

  • issue number (or actually, a number in general)
  • hashtag (following the twitter convention)
  • stream

Yeah, I'm slightly against this idea. We used to try to do the same thing with e.g. @Steve, but in practice people try typing that super rarely, and I think it's important to minimize pollution in what we translate automatically.
As an aside, we probably want to rename the git stream to something like git help. :)
Yeah, feel free to just do that @Steve Howell. I think step 2 is to document it in places like our git guide and maybe chat-zulip-org.md
